title.value: Improving microbial phylogeny with citizen science within a mass-market video game
title.justification: The title directly reflects the core contribution and subject of the paper which aims at improving microbial phylogeny using a mass-market video game approach through citizen science.
title.quote: Improving microbial phylogeny with citizen science within a mass-market video game

extractions.description: The paper describes the creation of Borderlands Science, a citizen science activity integrated into a mass-market video game, which uses player interaction to solve complex multiple sequence alignment tasks for microbial phylogeny, significantly improving results compared to standard computational methods.

type.justification: The paper discusses practical implementation and data collection to demonstrate improvements in microbial phylogeny using a gamified approach, providing empirical results.
type.quote: Leveraging these results, we show that our multiple sequence alignment simultaneously improves microbial phylogeny estimations and UniFrac effect sizes compared to state-of-the-art computational methods.

name.justification: The primary research field involves leveraging citizen science to contribute to genomic data analysis, particularly in microbial phylogeny.
name.quote: BLS demonstrates that commercial video games can provide massive human processing resources for the manual curation and analysis of large-scale genomic datasets that could not be completed otherwise.

name.justification: The alignment tasks solved by players are centered around microbial genomic data.
name.quote: BLS crowdsources a multiple alignment task of 1 million 16S ribosomal RNA sequences obtained from human microbiome studies.

name.justification: The research employs gamification as a tool in serious games to process scientific data and engage a broader audience.
name.quote: The classical approach to design CSGs relies on gamification—that is, the introduction of game design elements that facilitate the acquisition of the expertise needed to complete the activity and increase engagement.

name.justification: FastTree is specifically mentioned as a tool used for phylogenetic analysis in the research paper.
name.quote: We inferred phylogenetic trees from our alignments with FastTree.

is_contributed.justification: FastTree is not a contribution of the paper but a tool used within the research.
is_contributed.quote: The state-of-the-art method for building phylogenetic trees from alignments has been shown to be outperformed... with FastTree.

is_executed.justification: FastTree was executed to infer phylogenetic trees as part of the research analysis.
is_executed.quote: We inferred phylogenetic trees from our alignments with FastTree and then assessed their similarity to a reference tree.

is_compared.justification: FastTree output was compared to other alignment methods as part of the results analysis.
is_compared.quote: We report results for our BLS alignment and benchmark alignments produced by several state-of-the-art de novo multiple alignment programs (PASTA, MUSCLE and MAFFT) as well as an alignment produced by a greedy algorithm.

referenced_paper_title.value: FastTree 2—approximately maximum-likelihood trees for large alignments
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper titled in connection with FastTree in the context of this research is cited.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Price, M. N., Dehal, P. S. & Arkin, A. P. FastTree 2—approximately maximum-likelihood trees for large alignments.

name.justification: PASTA is used as a multiple sequence alignment method and compared with BLS results.
name.quote: Here we report results for our BLS alignment and benchmark alignments produced by several state-of-the-art de novo multiple alignment programs (PASTA, MUSCLE and MAFFT) as well as an alignment produced by a greedy algorithm.

is_contributed.justification: PASTA was used as a tool in the study and not developed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: PASTA: ultra-large multiple sequence alignment for nucleotide and amino-acid sequences.

is_executed.justification: PASTA was executed to produce initial alignments for comparison with BLS results.
is_executed.quote: These 9,667 sequences were then aligned with PASTA 1.9, generating a very tight (183 columns) initial alignment.

is_compared.justification: PASTA results were compared with alternative methods and BLS results.
is_compared.quote: Our results in Table 1 and Fig. 2 indicate that the additional gaps... led to an improvement of the tree structure compared to PASTA.

referenced_paper_title.value: PASTA: ultra-large multiple sequence alignment for nucleotide and amino-acid sequences
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper discusses using PASTA as a benchmark alignment method and refers to its original research paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Mirarab, S. et al. PASTA: ultra-large multiple sequence alignment for nucleotide and amino-acid sequences.

name.justification: The dataset used for solving alignment tasks is part of the American Gut Project, a major component of the research.
name.quote: BLS is designed to improve a reference multiple alignment of 1 million 16S ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences from The Microsetta Initiative’s (TMI) American Gut Project (AGP).

referenced_paper_title.value: American Gut: an open platform for citizen science microbiome research
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper gives credit to the original AGP paper as a major data source for their alignment tasks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: McDonald, D. et al. American Gut: an open platform for citizen science microbiome research.

name.justification: QIIME 2 was used for re-rooting sequences classified by naive Bayes with QIIME 2’s q2-feature-classifier against Greengenes 13.8.
name.quote: These trees were then re-rooted using sequences classified by naive Bayes with QIIME version 2’s q2-feature-classifier against Greengenes 13.8 with Archaea as the outgroup.

referenced_paper_title.value: QIIME 2 enables comprehensive end-to-end analysis of diverse microbiome data and comparative studies with publicly available data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original paper detailing QIIME 2 is referenced for its use in classifying sequences.
